cab.content: Printed for the Cabinet. May 1955SECRET Copy No. 96CP. (55) 194th May, 1955CABINETUSE OF OFFICIAL TRANSPORT DURING THE GENERAL ELECTIONNote by the Prime MinisterOfficial CarsDuring the period of the General Election Ministers may continue to use,for official purposes, official cars provided from the Government Car Service orotherwise; but these cars should not be used for journeys connected with theElection. It is also undesirable to use an official car, even on official business, ina Minister^ constituency, except where the Minister is unexpectedly called back from his constituency on urgent official business.Aircraft2. Service aircraft should not be used for journeys connected with theGeneral Election.3. The cost of civil aircraft should not be charged to public funds if usedfor journeys connected with the Election or other Party political business; but,exceptionally, a Minister, recalled unexpectedly to his Department for urgent officialbusiness, may claim repayment of the cost of an air journey if no other means oftransport would meet the needs of the case.A. E.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,4th May, 1955.
